bulk_table_view_tag_importer.py.description: Adds tag to set of tables or views

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help:
Path to CSV file containing asset names. The file may contain 1 or 2 columns: 
The first column can either contain the full asset name(db:schema.table) or the MCON value and the second(optional) will be the key:value of the tag

warehouse.help: Warehouse name as it appears in MC

bulk_domain_importer.py.description: Creates or updates a domain and its asset assignments. Every time this runs, it will overwrite the assignments.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help:
Path to CSV file containing the domain/asset mapping. The file must contains2 columns: 
The first column belongs to the domain name and the second will be the MCON id

Example:

Finance,MCON++123++456++table++transactions
Analytics,MCON++123++456++view++sessions

bulk_domain_exporter.py.description: Exports all domains and their asset assignments to a CSV file. The output can be used with bulk_domain_importer.py to migrate domains to another workspace.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

output_file.help:
Path to output CSV file.

Output format (no header):
Finance,MCON++123++456++table++transactions
Analytics,MCON++123++456++view++sessions

bulk_data_product_exporter.py.description: Exports all data products and their asset assignments to a CSV file. The output can be used with bulk_data_product_importer.py to migrate data products to another workspace.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

output_file.help:
Path to output CSV file.

Output format (with header):
data_product_name,data_product_description,asset_mcon
Customer Analytics,Analytics for customer data,MCON++123++456++table++customers

bulk_data_product_importer.py.description: Imports data products from a CSV file (exported from bulk_data_product_exporter.py). Creates or updates data products and assigns assets.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help:
Path to CSV file from bulk_data_product_exporter.py.

Expected format (with header):
data_product_name,data_product_description,asset_mcon
Customer Analytics,Analytics for customer data,MCON++123++456++table++customers

bulk_blocklist_exporter.py.description: Exports all blocklist entries to a CSV file. The output can be used with bulk_blocklist_importer.py to migrate blocklist entries to another workspace.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

output_file.help:
Path to output CSV file.

Output format (with header):
resource_id,target_object_type,match_type,dataset,project,effect

bulk_blocklist_importer.py.description: Imports blocklist entries from a CSV file (exported from bulk_blocklist_exporter.py). Skips entries that already exist.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help:
Path to CSV file from bulk_blocklist_exporter.py.

Expected format (with header):
resource_id,target_object_type,match_type,dataset,project,effect

bulk_tag_exporterv2.py.description: Exports all object tags (properties) to a CSV file. Exports from all warehouses by default, or a specific warehouse if specified. The output can be used with bulk_tag_importerv2.py to migrate tags to another workspace.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

output_file.help:
Path to output CSV file.

Output format (with header):
warehouse_id,full_table_id,tag_key,tag_value
abc-123-uuid,database:schema.table,owner,team_data

warehouse_id.help: Optional warehouse UUID to filter. If not specified, exports from all warehouses.

bulk_tag_importerv2.py.description: Imports object tags (properties) from a CSV file (exported from bulk_tag_exporterv2.py). Creates or updates tags on tables in the target environment.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help:
Path to CSV file from bulk_tag_exporterv2.py.

Expected format (with header):
warehouse_id,full_table_id,tag_key,tag_value
abc-123-uuid,database:schema.table,owner,team_data

add_remove_monitoring_rules.py.description:
Adds or removes tables as individual monitoring rules. 
Note: 100 monitoring rules is the limit

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input.help: Path to the txt file containing list of full table ids.

enable_monitored_table_volume_queries.py.description: Adds all tables that are monitored to row count monitoring

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

monitor_migration_util.py.description:
Export monitors from UI to MaC.

1. Run the utility in 'export' mode to generate MaC configuration.

2. Modify the 'monitors.yml' generated in step 1 to incorporate monitor changes.

3. Run the utility in 'migrate' mode (monitors will not be commited).

   • Set -f flag to create the monitors.

4. Once confirmed migrated monitors are working as expected, you may disable the original monitors by running the utility in 'disable' mode.

   • Alternatively, you can delete the original monitors by running the utility in 'cleanup' mode.

export.description: Export monitors from MC UI that match asset search pattern.
export.help: Export monitors from MC UI that match asset search pattern.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

asset.help: Asset Name. This can be a project, dataset or table. If UI contains database include it i.e. <database>:<schema>.

namespace.help: Namespace for the exported monitors. Defaults to --asset if not set.

migrate.description: Creates monitors as MaC after export.
migrate.help: Creates monitors as MaC after export.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

directory.help: Project directory where output files from 'export' action were generated.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

directory.help: Project directory where output files from 'export' action were generated.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

directory.help: Project directory where output files from 'export' action were generated.

monitor_promotion_util.py.description:
UI Monitor Promotion Util.

1. Run the utility in 'export' mode to generate MaC configuration and merge it to the master monitors.yml.

2. Run the utility in 'promote' mode (monitors will not be commited).

   • Set -f flag to create the monitors.

3. Run the utility in 'cleanup' mode to remove the UI monitors that were migrated to MaC

export.description: Export monitors from MC UI that are ready for promotion (where tag = 'ready_for_promotion').
export.help: Export monitors from MC UI that match asset search pattern.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

source_namespace.help: Temporary namespace for the exported monitors

target_namespace.help: Namespace where the monitor configuration will be merged

directory.help: Project directory where master monitors.yml resides

promote.description: Creates monitors as MaC after export.
promote.help: Creates monitors as MaC after export.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

directory.help: Project directory where master monitors.yml resides

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

directory.help: Project directory where output files from 'export' action were generated.

generate_monitors_yaml_from_csv.py.description: Generates monitor configuration as yaml file(MaC) from an input CSV file that contains rules. YML file will be written, which can then be used when syncing Monitors-as-Code.

input_csv.help: Path to CSV file containing all migration rules

output_dir.help: Directory where MaC files will get generated

bulk_export_monitors.py.description:
Exports monitor configuration as yaml file(MaC). YML file will be written, which can then be used when syncing Monitors-as-Code.

* Monitor 'name' is now a mandatory parameter to apply MaC.

* Set -e flag to 'y' to get monitor names included in the yaml export.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

export_name.help: Include the resource name in the export?

deduplicate_metric_monitors.py.description: Finds and removes duplicate metric monitors from an input YML file.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

delete_monitors_by_audience.py.description: Delete all monitors within a given audience.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

audience.help: Audience for which to delete all monitors. If multiple Audiences, pass all in comma separated list

bulk_set_freshness_sensitivity.py.description:
Updates freshness OOTB monitor sensitivity. 

* If updating to an explicit threshold, create a CSV with 3 columns: [full_table_id,cron,updated_in_last_minutes]
* If updating to an automatic threshold, create a CSV with 2 columns: [full_table_id,sensitivity].

Sensitivity must be one of LOW, MEDIUM or HIGH.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help: Relative or absolute path to csv file containing freshness monitor configuration.

bulk_update_comparison_monitor_dynamic_s.description:
Updates legacy comparison monitors dynamic schedules in bulk. 

* CSV must contain 2 columns: [monitor_id, asset]
* monitor_id refers to the monitor uuid available in the monitor page URL. It can also be obtained by downloading the Monitors Data Export from the UI: https://getmontecarlo.com/monitors
* The asset column refers to the full table id that will be tied to the dynamic schedule i.e. database:schema.table

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_file.help: Relative or absolute path to csv file.

link_tables_via_descriptions.py.description: Adds hyperlink in assets' description to link tables/views that match based on name within different schemas

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

a_source.help: Database & Schema in the format db:schema

b_source.help: Database & Schema in the format db:schema

workspace_migrator.py.description:
Workspace migration utility for Monte Carlo configurations.

Export, import, and validate domains, data products, and blocklists between environments.

Examples:
	# Export all entities
	python migration/workspace_migrator.py export --profile source_env

	# Export specific entities
	python migration/workspace_migrator.py export --profile source_env --entities domains,blocklists

	# Import (dry-run by default)
	python migration/workspace_migrator.py import --profile target_env

	# Import with force (commit changes)
	python migration/workspace_migrator.py import --profile target_env --force yes

	# Validate migration files
	python migration/workspace_migrator.py validate --profile target_env

export.description: Export domains, data products, and blocklists to CSV files.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

output_dir.help: Directory to write export files. Defaults to migration/migration-data-exports/

import.description: Import domains, data products, and blocklists from CSV files. Dry-run by default.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_dir.help: Directory containing import files. Defaults to migration/migration-data-exports/

force.help: Set to 'yes' to commit changes. Default is dry-run (preview only).

validate.description: Validate migration CSV files before importing.

profile.help: Specify an MCD profile name. Uses default otherwise.

input_dir.help: Directory containing files to validate. Defaults to migration/migration-data-exports/
